Laura Miloš also bid adieu to Association Sportive Saint-Raphaël Volley-Ball on the same day, while Hana Fančovičová's tenure with Hc Škp Bratislava came to a close on January 1st, 2022. Paolo Banchero, meanwhile, left the Duke Blue Devils men's basketball team on January 1st, 2022. These departures signal significant changes in the athletic landscape, and fans are eagerly awaiting news of their next moves.
Several notable basketball players have announced their departures from their respective teams. Peter Kiss, a standout player for the Bryant Bulldogs men's basketball team, has ended his affiliation with the organization as of Saturday, January 1st, 2022. Berthrade Bikatal and Demitrius Conger, also basketball players, have parted ways with Évreux Volley-Ball and BC Oostende, respectively, as of the same date. Moussa Diabaté, a talented player, has stopped competing in NCAA Division I Men's Basketball as of Saturday, January 1st, 2022.

**THU, DEC 30, 2021: NEW YEAR, NEW MEMBERSHIPS**As we approach the start of a new year, several prominent universities have announced their membership in prestigious international organizations. Notably, the Sichuan International Studies University, Polytechnic University of Tirana, and University of Montenegro have all become members of the Agence universitaire de la Francophonie, a leading organization promoting higher education within the French-speaking world. This development comes as the University of Namibia has joined the Association of African Universities, a network dedicated to advancing higher education in Africa. These new affiliations are set to take effect on January 1, 2022, marking a significant milestone for these institutions as they embark on a new year of academic and cultural exchange.
TODAY IN THE WORLD OF EDUCATION, JANUARY 3RD, 2022In a significant development, several prominent universities have announced their membership in prestigious international organizations. On January 1st, 2022, the Technical University of Civil Engineering of Bucharest began its affiliation with the Agence universitaire de la Francophonie, a leading organization promoting higher education in French-speaking countries. This move comes as Vietnam National University, Hanoi and Sanaa University also joined the same organization on the same day. Meanwhile, the University of Burundi marked its entry into the Association of African Universities on January 1st, 2022. These new affiliations are expected to open up new avenues for collaboration and knowledge sharing among these institutions.
**FRIDAY, JANUARY 7, 2022 - GLOBAL HIGHER EDUCATION UPDATE**This week, several prominent institutions made significant announcements regarding their membership in esteemed academic organizations. On January 1st, 2022, the Badji Mokhtar Annaba University became a member of the Association of African Universities, a move that is expected to foster greater collaboration and knowledge sharing within the African academic community. The University of Lviv, also on the same day, joined the Agence universitaire de la Francophonie, a network of institutions that promotes Francophone culture and education worldwide. Meanwhile, the École nationale des sciences géographiques, a French institution, solidified its ties with the Agence universitaire de la Francophonie on the same day. JāmiʻAt Baḥ Rī, another African institution, also became a member of the Association of African Universities on January 1st, marking a significant milestone in its academic journey.

On January 1st, 2022, Princess Nora bint Abdul Rahman University joined the Agence universitaire de la Francophonie, a leading organization promoting higher education in French-speaking countries. The University of Niš and National University of La Plata also joined the Agence universitaire de la Francophonie on the same day. Meanwhile, the Ecole Normale Supérieure De Nouakchott took a different path, becoming a member of the Association of African Universities, also on January 1st, 2022.
In a series of significant developments, several prominent universities have announced their membership with various esteemed organizations. On January 1st, 2022, Mogadishu University began its affiliation with the Somali Research And Education Network. The University of Warsaw also started its membership with the Agence universitaire de la Francophonie on the same day. In a separate move, the University of Zimbabwe joined the Association of African Universities on Saturday, January 1st, 2022, while the University of Liberia made a similar announcement on January 1st, 2022, also becoming a member of the Association of African Universities.

Lieb was awarded the Carl Friedrich Gauss Prize, while Volker Mehrmann received the Fellow Of The American Mathematical Society. Reuben Jonathan Miller, meanwhile, was recognized with a spot in the prestigious MacArthur Fellows Program. John Patrick Campbell Greenlees rounded out the group, taking home the Berwick Prize.

The Czech Science Foundation joined Science Europe on Saturday, January 1st, 2022, and Portugal's Fundação para a Ciência e Tecnologia also became a member of the same organization on the same day. The National Recovery and Resilience Agency underwent significant changes in its ownership in 2022. The agency initially began being owned by the Department of Home Affairs on July 1st, 2022. However, its ownership was transferred to the Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet on the same day, marking a brief period of dual ownership. The agency's ownership was later finalized with the Department of Home Affairs on September 1st, 2022, ending the tenure of the Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet. Meanwhile, Emergency Management Australia also transferred its ownership to the Department of Home Affairs on September 1st, 2022, bringing an end to its previous ownership.
Science Europe Welcomes New Members in the New Year. The year 2022 kicked off with several prominent research institutions joining esteemed international organizations. According to sources, the Health Research Board became a member of Science Europe on Saturday, January 1st, 2022. This move was mirrored by Agence nationale de la recherche, which also started its membership with Science Europe on the same day, albeit without specifying the date format. Across the globe, other notable institutions also joined their respective international associations. The Mongolian Academy of Sciences became a member of the Association Of Academies And Societies Of Sciences In Asia on January 1st, 2022, marking the beginning of a new partnership. Meanwhile, global soccer star Cristiano Ronaldo has revealed that his home is no longer in Manchester, a city where he has been a prominent figure in recent years.
In a flurry of New Year's Day transfers, several footballers saw their club affiliations change. Théo Braillon bid farewell to Football Bourg-en-Bresse Péronnas 01, while Oier Sanjurjo's time at CA Osasuna came to an end. On the other hand, Kalidou Koulibaly began his tenure at Chelsea F. C. Meanwhile, Ramin Rezaeian's stint with Al-Duhail SC drew to a close.
In a series of New Year's Day football roster moves, several high-profile players announced their new team affiliations. Aleksandr Guz became a member of the Belarus national under-19 football team, while Dele Alli joined Everton F. C. Eden Kartsev also made a move, signing with FC Dynamo Moscow, and Ben Davies (born 1995) started his tenure with Rangers F. C. These changes were all confirmed on Saturday, January 1st, 2022.
New Year Brings Changes in Soccer Rosters: Several football players have bid farewell to their respective clubs as the calendar flipped to 2022. On January 1st, Joseba Muguruza and Luca Sangalli officially parted ways with CE Sabadell FC and Real Sociedad B respectively, marking the end of their stints with the teams. Meanwhile, Yevgeny Beryozkin made a significant move as he started his membership with FC Torpedo-BelAZ Zhodino on the same day. Leandro Morante's departure from LB Châteauroux on January 1st, 2022, however, occurred a day later than Muguruza and Sangalli's exit, which took place on the same day but without a specified time.

Independiente del Valle, announced that he would no longer be working for the organization, effective Sunday, May 1. Meanwhile, in the world of football, Vladislav Rusanov (footballer) ended his affiliation with FC Energetik-BGU Minsk on the same day, while Dzmitryj Maciaš and Jaŭhien Huliecki both parted ways with FC Rukh Brest, also on May 1.
In recent news, several notable figures have made significant changes to their affiliations with various sports organizations. Rareș Ispas officially parted ways with Sepsi OSK Sfântu Gheorghe as of May 1st, 2022. Similarly, Maksim Lutskiy's tenure with FC Rukh Brest came to an end on May 1st, 2022. Miroslav Khlebosolov's departure from FC Energetik-BGU Minsk also occurred on the same day, May 1st, 2022. Meanwhile, Filipp Rudik began his new chapter as a member of FC Smorgon, commencing his affiliation with the team on Sunday, May 1st, 2022.
In a shocking turn of events in the world of professional football, several key players have announced their departures from their respective teams. On Sunday, May 1st, 2022, Uladzislaŭ Šubovič and Artem Miroyevskiy both ended their membership with FC Rukh Brest, a move that has left fans reeling. Meanwhile, Ruslan Gurbanov made a similar announcement, confirming that he would no longer be a member of FC Slavia Mozyr, also on the same day. However, not all departures were negative, as Stefan Mueller, a talented young player, made his debut with Rio Grande Valley FC Toros, joining the team on Tuesday, May 3rd, 2022, marking a new chapter in his football career.
In recent football news, several notable players have made significant changes to their teams. Romaine Sawyers, a skilled player, has started being a member of the West Bromwich Albion F. C. as of Wednesday, May 4, 2022. This development comes after he also joined the Saint Kitts and Nevis national football team on the same day. Meanwhile, Uladzislaŭ Drapieza has become a member of FC Gomel, effective Sunday, May 8th, 2022. Brandan Craig, a talented player, has also started being a part of the Philadelphia Union as of Monday, May 9, 2022.

Yevgeny Kozel and Vitaliy Ganich also parted ways with their respective teams, FC Shakhtyor Soligorsk and FC Shakhtyor Petrikov, as of December 1st.
In recent football news, several players have undergone roster changes. Nikolay Zolotov marked his debut with FC Kolos Kovalivka, joining the team on Thursday, 2022-12-01. Meanwhile, several players have bid farewell to their respective clubs. Zaim Divanović, Vladyslav Pavlenko, and Raman Stsyapanaw have all ended their stints with FC Shakhtyor Soligorsk and FC Rubikon Kyiv. Zaim Divanović and Raman Stsyapanaw's departures from FC Shakhtyor Soligorsk both took place on December 1st, 2022, while Vladyslav Pavlenko's exit from FC Rubikon Kyiv also occurred on the same day.
In a series of moves that have left the football world abuzz, several players have parted ways with their respective clubs. Lastly, Denis Laptev has parted ways with FC Torpedo Moscow, a decision that was made official on 2022-12-01.

In a series of unexpected alliances, several Ukrainian states have started neighboring entities from outside their borders. On Thursday, 2022-09-29, Zaporozhye State began its relations with the Donetsk People's Republic, marking a significant shift in the regional dynamics. The same day, Zaporozhye State also started neighboring Kherson State. Interestingly, Kherson State reciprocated by starting a neighboring relation with Zaporozhye State on the same day. Furthermore, Kherson State extended its neighboring ties to Russia on September 29th, 2022.
A significant escalation in the ongoing conflict unfolded on September 29th, 2022, as the Russian invasion of Ukraine commenced in Kherson State. Just a day later, the situation took another turn as Zaporozhye State ceased to be a neighbor of Donetsk People's Republic and Kherson State on September 30th, 2022. Furthermore, the Donetsk People's Republic was also dropped as a participant in the Russian invasion of Ukraine on the same day, marking a pivotal shift in the conflict's dynamics.
Ukraine Conflict Escalates as Regional Entities Shift Alliances. As of Friday, September 30th, 2022, the Kherson State has ceased to be a neighbor of Russia, according to recent developments. Separately, the Russian invasion of Ukraine has reached a new milestone, with the conflict's end location shifting to the Donetsk People's Republic and the Luhansk People's Republic by the end of the same day. Furthermore, the Kherson State has also severed ties with another neighboring state, Zaporozhye State, on the same day.

Meanwhile, Magnus Kulset, Quentin Jaurégui, and Mylène De Zoete all parted ways with their respective teams, Uno-X Dare Development Team, B& B Hotels– KTM, and AG Insurance– Soudal– Quick-Step, on January 1st, 2022.
In a flurry of New Year's changes, several professional cyclists bid farewell to their teams. Alessandro Monaco marked the beginning of his 2022 season by joining Giotti Victoria– Savini Due on Saturday, January 1st, 2022. However, other riders were not as fortunate in their team affiliations. Sebastian Nielsen, Tusnelda Svanholmer, and Alessandro Tuscano all ended their membership with Restaurant Suri– Carl Ras, Amager Cykle Ring, and Bingoal Pauwels Sauces WB Development Team respectively on the same day.
In cycling news, several athletes have undergone team changes to begin the new year. Mareille Meijering started her membership with the Multum Accountants Ladies Cycling Team on January 1, 2022, while Jack Burke joined Team Felbermayr– Simplon Wels on the same day. However, the year got off to a bittersweet start for Romy Kasper, who left Team Jumbo– Visma (women's team) on January 1, 2022. Meanwhile, Jack Bauer bid farewell to Team Jayco– AlUla (men's team) on the same day.
As the year began, several professional cyclists made significant changes to their teams. On January 1st, 2022, Pietro Aimonetto marked the start of a new chapter as a member of Beltrami TSA– Tre Colli. Meanwhile, the end of an era was witnessed for several riders, including Alan Boileau, who left B& B Hotels– KTM, and Petra Stiasny, who parted ways with Israel Premier Tech Roland. Alena Amialiusik also bid farewell to Velocio– SRAM Pro Cycling on the same day, bringing an end to her tenure with the team.

A month into the year 2022, Softbank Mobile started being owned by The Master Trust Bank of Japan, marking the beginning of a new era in its corporate history.

In a separate development, KDDI underwent a dual ownership change on Friday, September 30th, 2022, as the company started being owned by both Toyota and The Master Trust Bank of Japan.

SUN, DEC 26TH, 2021: YEAR IN MUSIC: NOTABLE WINS AND ACCOLADESAs the music industry continues to evolve, several notable albums have made their mark in recent years. One such album is 'Sour', which marked its victory in the prestigious Grammy Award for Best Pop Vocal Album on January 1st, 2022. This recognition is a testament to the artist's dedication and hard work. In a similar vein, the album "L' Emprise" has also been making waves in the music scene. The album started off strong by winning a Gold record on December 1st, 2022. However, it wasn't long before it achieved even greater heights, winning a Platinum record on December 15th, 2022. These accomplishments showcase the album's widespread appeal and the artist's ability to connect with audiences worldwide.

On January 1st, 2022, the American Physiological Society joined the Association of Learned and Professional Society Publishers, marking a significant shift in its membership. The American Society Of Plant Biologists and Portland Press also made the same move, joining the Association of Learned and Professional Society Publishers on the same day. However, the Association of American Publishers chose a different path, opting to affiliate with the International Association of Scientific, Technical, and Medical Publishers on the same date.
In a series of coordinated moves, several prominent entities have announced their affiliation with various organizations. The American Mathematical Society marked the beginning of its membership with the International Association of Scientific, Technical, and Medical Publishers on January 1st, 2022. IOP Publishing and the Royal College of General Practitioners have also joined forces with other groups, with IOP Publishing starting its membership with the Association of Learned and Professional Society Publishers on the same day, and the Royal College of General Practitioners following suit. The International Atomic Energy Agency has also begun its membership with the International Association of Scientific, Technical, and Medical Publishers, further solidifying its ties with the scientific community.

EBSCO Information Services kicked off the year by becoming a member of the International Association of Scientific, Technical, and Medical Publishers, effective Saturday, January 1st, 2022. Meanwhile, Brill Publishers, Emerald Group Publishing, and the British Institute of Radiology all joined the Association of Learned and Professional Society Publishers on the same day, with Brill and Emerald Group Publishing making the announcement on Saturday, January 1st, 2022, and the British Institute of Radiology confirming its membership on January 1st, 2022.

The Institute and Faculty of Actuaries marked the start of its affiliation with the Association of Learned and Professional Society Publishers on January 1st of that year. This development came as the Association of Learned and Professional Society Publishers itself began its membership with the International Association of Scientific, Technical, and Medical Publishers on the same day. Meanwhile, Portland Press also joined the International Association of Scientific, Technical, and Medical Publishers on January 1st, 2022. The Royal Geographical Society, however, started its membership with the Association of Learned and Professional Society Publishers on the same day, Saturday, January 1st, 2022.

Wikidata Celebrates 10th Birthday with Global Tour. The Wikimedia Foundation's flagship knowledge base, Wikidata, marked its 10th anniversary with a series of international events. The festivities kicked off in Istanbul on October 1, 2022. However, the celebration soon shifted to Perth, where the first event was held on October 8th of the same year. Following the Perth stop, the Wikidata team made their way to Cotonou on October 11, 2022. The final leg of the tour took place in Nairobi on October 14th, 2022.
The Wikidata community marked a significant milestone with the celebration of its 10th birthday, kicking off a series of events in various locations around the world. The festivities began in Lucerne on Wednesday, October 19th, 2022, before moving to Vienna on the same day. However, the main event then shifted to Sydney, where it started on Saturday, October 22nd, 2022. The final leg of the celebration took place in São Paulo, where it commenced on Tuesday, October 25th, 2022.

The festivities began in Rome, where the event started on Friday, October 28, 2022. The celebration also commenced in Lisbon, also on the same day, October 28, 2022, marking a dual-city start. Meanwhile, in Turin and Fisciano, the event started on the same day, October 28, 2022, as the event organizers chose to make the day a memorable one by kicking off the celebration in multiple cities."

The festivities kicked off in New Delhi, where Wikidata started its journey, marking the beginning of a new decade. From there, the event moved to Cotonou on November 10th, but it didn't stay there for long. By the next day, November 11th, the celebration had made its way to Nairobi, where it came to an end. Just a day later, on Sunday, November 6th, the series moved to its next destination, concluding at the same Falmouth location.
